messages.title: Tough but fair action to get us out of recession and support you and your family.
messages.content: Labour has clear plans to cut the deficit - but at the right time and fairly. This will mean tough action - like a new top rate of tax for those earning over £150,000 - but we will also protect the frontline services we all rely on - the NHS, schools and the police.

messages.title: Dignity and security in old age
messages.content: Labour's action for pensioners: Winter Fuel Payments for all pensioners; free off-peak bus travel; free TV licences for over 75s; free eye tests and flu jabs.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Fight for continued investment in better schools, world-class hospitals and safer streets.
Affordable, high quality homes and local services to match.
Ensure that new tram lines, extra local buses and faster rail links get the go ahead.
Don't let the Tories remove the ban on fox hunting.
No second job and a fully staffed constituency office.

issues.economy: Labour has clear plans to cut the deficit - but at the right time and fairly.
issues.education: Fight for continued investment in... better schools...
issues.environment: Ensure that new tram lines, extra local buses and faster rail links get the go ahead.
issues.health: Fight for continued investment in... world-class hospitals...
issues.socialWelfare: Labour's action for pensioners: Winter Fuel Payments for all pensioners; free off-peak bus travel; free TV licences for over 75s; free eye tests and flu jabs.

housing.content: Affordable, high quality homes and local services to match.

contactInformation.address: Nottingham Labour, Unit 13a, John Folman Business Centre Hungerhill Road, Nottingham NG3 4NB

quotes.text: 6,000 more nurses in the East Midlands means waiting lists of 18 weeks, not 18 months.
48% more funding per pupil since 1997, 39% more Nottingham children leave school with 5 or more GCSEs.
The National Minimum Wage, tax credits pay and Winter Fuel Payments for every pensioner housed.

images.caption: Discussions on a variety of topics including policies, pledges, and personal interactions.
Lilian Greenwood at Dunkirk's refurbished Spider Park.

leaflet.additionalNotes: The leaflet campaigns on various issues, including the economy, health, and education, and presents a number of pledges and achievements. It provides contact information and social media channels for the Labour candidate.
